title: Meghan cooks Grenfell
story: Meghan cooks with women in the Hubb Community Kitchen at the Al Manaar Muslim Cultural Heritage Centre in West London    Their partnership has resulted in the publications of Together: Our Community Cookbook, which features personal recipes          The Duchess of Sussex cooks with women in the Hubb Community Kitchen in the aftermath of the Grenfell Tower fire  The duchess first visited the kitchen in January and has made a number other private trips to the centre to meet volunteers          The Duchess of Sussex plays with a young girl after cooking with women in the Hubb Community Kitchen in West London          One of the contributors to the book said she and her friends had approached Al-Manaar to ask if they could use the kitchen Revealed: How two women who cooked with Meghan were heroines...'I'm going to kill you, you fat f*****': Meghan Markle's...'Could you bring the car round for David and Davina?':...Share this article    Some of the recipes are family favourites and all have been created by the cooks who support residents affected by the fire          The Duchess's involvement with the kitchen has resulted in the publication of Together: Our Community Cookbook  Meghan helped put the group in touch with a publisher and her Royal Foundation provided assistance with legal issues          Meghan has written the foreword to the new book produced by cooks from the Hubb Community Kitchen          The Duchess of Sussex's support of the book's publication marks her first solo project as a member of the royal family          The dishes described in the book are the women's l recipes from across Europe, the Middle East and North Africa          Some of the recipes included in the book are family favourites and all have been created by the cooks            In the introduction, the women of the Hubb Community Kitchen write that the kitchen 'has always been a place of good food'          (From left) Hiwot Dagnachew, Aysha Bora, Halima Al-huthaifi, Ahlam Saeid and Munira Mahmud cooking in the kitchen           Intlak Al Saiegh and Ahlam Saeid cook in the Hubb Community Kitchen at the Al Manaar Muslim Cultural Heritage Centre          Halima Al-huthaifi and Ahlam Saeid enjoy the food in the Hubb Community Kitchen in West London      Halima Al-huthaifi and Zahira Ghaswala (left) and Munira Mahmud (right) in the community kitchen in West London          Food on the table in the Hubb Community Kitchen at the Al Manaar Muslim Cultural Heritage Centre in West London          Meghan has written the foreword to the new book produced by cooks from the Hubb Community Kitchen          The Grenfell disaster in North Kensington, West London, took place on June 14 last year and claimed the lives of 72 people        Hiwot Dagnachew (left) and Munira Mahmud (right) escaped from the Grenfell Tower infernoMeanwhile, Munira Mahmud, 34, her husband Mohammed Rasoul, 36, his father Ahmed Abdel-Rasoul, then aged 87, and their two children Mohammed, six, and 20-month-old Zahra Rasoul made their way down the stairs to the bottom of the tower to safety in June last year.The women are two of the cooks in a new book supported by the Duchess of Sussex in her first solo charity project called Together, Our Community Cookbook, which will be available in stores from Thursday priced at £9.99.Meghan – who has made secret trips to help the Hubb Community Kitchen volunteers responsible since January this year and has written the foreword – says of the kitchen: 'It's a place for women to laugh, cry and cook together'.Ms Mekonnen – who has her aunt, one of the cooks Hiwot Dagnachew, to thank for her family surviving the tragedy, has told the Telegraph: 'We were fast asleep and my phone rang – I'm so lucky it wasn't on silent.            The Duchess of Sussex cooks with women in the Hubb Community Kitchen in West London'My aunt was trying to be calm but she was clearly panicking. She said there were flames outside her window and that we should get out.'            Ms Mahmud made her way down the stairs to the bottom of the tower to safety  last yearShe told how she put on her dressing gown, grabbed her children, trying to keep them 'calm' whilst in 'complete shock' and ran out into the corridor.She told how it was 'hard to breathe', as she held Liva, five, under one arm and held Yohana's hand and descended the stairs, while they were 'coughing and the kids were screaming'.People were getting 'really, really scared' and 'running back up the stairs', leaving her 'tempted to go back but, I just couldn't see myself being locked in the flat on the 19th floor with that fire, so I carried on. The girls were so heavy.'Just as they were about to open an emergency fire exit a firefighter screamed at them to stop because that side of the building above was on fire. Ms Mekonnen couldn't even finish her sentence as she wonders aloud: 'If he hadn't… I can't believe we are alive.'Ms Mahmud's husband Mohammed has admitted he often 'thinks back' to that night when it took them all about 15 minutes to get to the bottom floor with his elderly father, telling GetWestLondon: 'I thank God we got out early and we made it.'He revealed that his wife's best friend and his children's friends passed away, as well as his friend's mother.He said of his friend: 'Me and him, we had both been in the tower since birth.'He told how all their closest friends were there and how he 'prays' that they're going to be 'reunited' with them one day.             Meghan poses with women at the Al Manaar Muslim Cultural Heritage Centre in West LondonMs Mahmud wrote of her involvement with the book: 'Last summer, we were placed in a hotel and I had no kitchen to cook for my family.'It was very emotional for me to get in the kitchen. The moment I started cooking I was in tears. I didn't know why though. I was just excited to be back in the kitchen again.'Word started to spread - the mums from my son's school came along and they told their friends, too. Soon there were women from different cultures all cooking, swapping recipes, talking and laughing together.'She told how Meghan - photographed on the book's front cover helping out - had been happy to pitch in, continuing: 'She wore an apron. I can't believe I made her wash rice!'After the duchess found out that we could only use the kitchen twice a week due to funding, she mentioned, 'How about sharing your recipes with other people?'Ms Mahmud added: 'And that's how it happened.' TOGETHER: Our Community Cookbook: Amazon.co.uk: The Hubb Community Kitchen, HRH The Duchess of Sussex: 9781529102925: BooksTOGETHER: Our Community Cookbook: Amazon.co.uk: The Hubb Community Kitchen, HRH The Duchess of Sussex: 9781529102925: Books

title: Soon Yi Previn says Woody Allen pursued relationship her
story: Woody Allen's wife Soon-Yi Previn (pictured with Allen in 2016) – the estranged adopted daughter of Mia Farrow – has said the director 'took a big leap' and pursued her          Previn said she and Allen fell in love in 1992 and they developed a bond after going to Knicks games together. Pictured, the pair at a Knicks game in 1994'He pursued me. That's why the relationship has worked: He's usually a meek person, and he took a big leap.'She declared that she was 'madly in love with him' and 'completely attracted to him, physically and sexually.'But she also claims that she 'came to realize how understanding he was' and that he 'grew on me.'Soon-Yi Previn eviscerates 'vengeful and abusive' mother Mia...'Woody Allen abused me when I was seven years old': Dylan...Share this articleLater, she recalls the moment after the pair first kissed.'I think Woody liked the fact that I had chutzpah when he first kissed me and I said, 'I wondered how long it was going to take you to make a move,' she said.'From the first kiss I was a goner and loved him.'But their first friendly encounter came after she broke her ankle playing soccer in the 11th grade, she said.          Soon-Yi Previn and Woody Allen at a New York Knicks game at Madison Square Garden in 2006When she got home, Allen looked at her ankle and suggested she see a doctor.After this incident, the pair began going to Knicks games together.When they began their 'fling,' both planned to keep it a secret and neither thought it would last.'It only became a relationship really when we were thrown together because of the molestation charge,' Previn said.The comment refers to Dylan Farrow's allegations that Allen abused her in 1992 when she was seven-years-old.Allen was investigated but wasn't charged, and he has long denied inappropriately touching his adopted daughter.He faced a wave of backlash earlier this year including several prominent actors vowing not to work with him again.In a statement in January after Dylan's allegations resurfaced, Allen reiterated his denial and accused her and her family of using the Time's Up movement 'to repeat this discredited allegation.'          Previn (pictured right, with Allen, Mia Farrow and their children in 1986) said she fell in love in 1992 with Allen, who was Farrow's boyfriend at the timeThe director is also quoted in the New York piece.'I am a pariah,' he said during a lunch with the author.'People think that I was Soon-Yi's father, that I raped and married my underaged, retarded daughter.'He adds: 'We weren't thinking, My God, let's get married.'Our relationship deepened as we went through the barrage of terrible accusations, and the paparazzi forced us to take walks only on my penthouse roof.'Previn told the magazine that she decided to speak out now because Dylan Farrow, is, in her view, unfairly accusing her husband of sexual abusing her when she was a child.'I was never interested in writing a `Mommie Dearest,' getting even with Mia - none of that,' Previn told the magazine.    Previn (pictured with Allen in 2010) said she decided to speak out now because Dylan Farrow, is, in her view, unfairly accusing her husband of sexual abusing her when she was a child'But what's happened to Woody is so upsetting, so unjust. (Mia) has taken advantage of the #MeToo movement and paraded Dylan as a victim. And a whole new generation is hearing about it when they shouldn't.'Previn also said she and her mother clashed soon after Farrow adopted her and that her mother many times treated her like a maid.She also said of Farrow: 'Mia wasn't maternal to me from the get-go.'An email sent to Mia Farrow's agent Sunday night was not immediately returned.In separate statements posted on Twitter on Sunday night, Dylan Farrow and Ronan Farrow say their mother is a good parent and that the New York magazine article is inaccurate and unfair.Dylan also noted that the New York magazine piece's author, Daphne Merkin, calls herself a longtime friend of Allen's.

title: Colin Jost Michael Che aim Roseanne Emmys
story: Michael Che and Colin Jost kicked off the Emmys with jokes that ranged from Roseanne Barr's canceled show to Ronan Farrow's impact on the #MeToo movement'She's had a rough year,' Che added. 'I heard Roseanne is moving to Israel.' 'I mean damn, how messed up is your life you have to go to the Middle East to get peace of mind?' The hosts then mentioned Laurie Metcalfe, who received a supporting actress nomination for her work on Roseanne, to a round of applause from the audience.'You know how great you have to be to get nominated for Roseanne now?' Che asked the crowd. 'That's like nominating a cop for a BET award, it doesn't happen - that would be weird.' The #MeToo movement was also a big part of the SNL hosts' monologue, hardly a surprise after it consumed television with the downfalls of Les Moonves, Matt Lauer, Louis CK, and Charlie Rose in the last year.'You know it's an honor to be here sharing this night with the many talented and creative people who haven't been caught yet,' they joked.   'This year the audience is allowed to drink in their seats...cause the one thing Hollywood needs right now are people losing their inhibitions at award functions,' Jost added.  The hosts, who came back onto the stage 40 minutes after the show began to note all six of the first awards had been won by white people, also touched on ersityHe noted that Netflix had the most nominations for the night, adding: 'If you're a network executive that's the scariest thing you can probably hear...except, Sir, Ronan Farrow is on line one,' he quipped to a roar of laughter from the crowd, noting how the New Yorker journalist has broken a slew of #MeToo exposes. 'You don't want that call,' Che added. The hosts, who came back onto the stage 40 minutes after the show began to note all six of the first awards had been won by white people, also touched on ersity. Regina King would go on to take the Emmy for lead actress in a limited series  more than an hour into the show.'My mother doesn't like watching white award shows cause you guys don't thank Jesus enough,' Che joked. 'The only white people who thank Jesus are Republicans and ex-crackheads.' Che then noted how although things were getting better, television has 'always had a ersity problem'.           The monologue came after an all-star song and dance number that jokingly claimed Hollywood had solved its long-running ersity problem          'One step closer to Black Sheldon,' Thompson jokes before the song begins, referring to the main character of The Big Bang Theory          Kristen Bell and Tituss Burgess then came on the stage to join the elaborate productionChe also joked about The Handmaid's Tale being painted as a show of fiction. 'The Handmaid's Tale takes place in an imaginary future where a group of people are forced to work and make babies against their will,' he began. 'That's what black people call history.' The hosts also took a subtle aim at Donald Trump as they brought up the Obamas new production deal with Netflix. 'My dream is they only produce their own version of The Apprentice and it gets way higher ratings,' Che said.  The monologue came after an all-star song and dance number that jokingly claimed Hollywood had solved its long-running ersity problem.           They patted themselves on the back for giving Sandra Oh the first Emmy leading actress nomination to an Asian woman. 'It's an honor just to be Asian,' she joked (next to her mother)SNL stars Kate McKinnon and Kenan Thompson kicked off the number, noting this year's Emmys had the most erse group of nominees in history. 'One step closer to Black Sheldon,' Thompson jokes, referring to the main character of The Big Bang Theory.'I'm gonna go ahead and say it, we solved it!' he then proclaims.'Seriously?' Kate asks excitedly. 'So ersity isn't a problem in Hollywood anymore?''Nope, we solved it!' Thompson says.They joke that they kindly gave Asian people 'that one show', referring to Fresh Off The Boat, before adding: 'Who can forget the amazing Sandra Oh?' Oh, the first Asian woman to ever be nominated for a lead Emmy actress award, emphatically thanks them before joking: 'It's an honor just to be Asian'.           Suddenly Ricky Martin appears and stops the production. 'You haven't solved it,' he says. 'This is way too white,' before leading them in the dance number           Suddenly Andy Samberg descends from the ceiling, perched on a cutout of the moon and asking 'Is there any room for a straight white guy like me?' 'You see there none, now there's one!' Thompson exclaims.'And so we're done,' McKinnon jokes.   'We've solved it, we've gotten with the times,' they continue to sing, touching on the #MeToo movement as Kenan tells the crowd to give itself a pat on the back.'But don't touch your neighbor!' Mckinnon interjects. 'We solved it, banished every creep who broke the law,' they continue, as Tituss Burgess and Kristen Bell join them on stage. 'Won't cut them any slack, they've been away a month now let them all come back!' they continue, alluding to Lauer and Louis CK's attempts to stage comebacks.Sterling K Brown then joins the group to congratulate the room.           They then announce they're going to check all the boxes, and bring out a whole group of erse dancers wearing a rainbow of colors          John Legend, who recently completed the EGOT, crooned for the crowd as he joined the song'Look at us, we're all different in the same way. We solved it, this room is so erse,' he sings, before jokingly pointing out they're all Democrats. Suddenly, Ricky Martin appears and stops the production. 'You haven't solved it,' he says. 'This is way too white.' The production then continues as Martin leads them in a dance, before Burgess jokes: 'We know exactly where we stand, with Roseanne!' 'No!' the rest of the celebrities yell. Suddenly Andy Samberg descends from the ceiling, perched on a cutout of the moon.           RuPaul suddenly appeared on the stage, saying he had a phone call for Thompson to take           'Uh hello?' Thompson says into the phone. 'Oh, we did not solve it, I see, long way to go, okay, cart before the horse, okay very good. I appreciate your call''But what about me?' he croons. Thompson says into the phone. 'Oh, we did not solve it. I see, long way to go, okay, cart before the horse, okay very good. I appreciate your call.' 'Thank you, Ru,' he says, handing back the phone. 'You called me up here for one line in your stupid skit? Y'all ain't right,' RuPaul replies, alluding to the lack of LGBTQ characters on television. Then John Legend appears on the stage to sing, as Chrissy Teigen jokingly tries to avoid being included in the camera shot as it turns to the audience.'They solved it,' Legend croons to the crowd, 'Through the magic of TV!           Then night was dominated by Amazon's The Marveous Mrs Maisel, which took home five trophies, including best comedy and best lead actress in a comedy           But it was Glenn Weiss who stole the show after he proposed to his girlfriend following his win in the directing for a variety special category 'We solved it, we solved it, we solved it,' they happily sing as fake firework graphics explode behind them on a screen. Then night was dominated by Amazon's The Marvelous Mrs Maisel, which took home trophies for best comedy, best lead actress in a comedy, best supporting actress in a comedy, and best writing and directing in a comedy. Netflix was the biggest winner of the night, nabbing seven Emmy awards thanks to wins from series including The Crown, Godless, and Black Mirror.Claire Foy took home the best lead actress trophy for her portrayal of Queen Elizabeth II, disappointing many who hoped to see Sandra Oh make history.   Claire Foy took home the best lead actress trophy for her portrayal of Queen Elizabeth II in The Crown, while Peter Dinklage scored a best supporting actor trophy for Game of Thrones          Network FX also managed to score five wins thanks to the success of the Assassination of Gianni Versace, which took home three awards reclaiming the trophy it won in both 2015 and 2016. Peter Dinklage also scored an Emmy for supporting actor in a drama, helping HBO nab six wins on Monday night. The Americans also finally got some recognition for its final season, scooping up awards for writing in a drama and lead actor in a drama, which went to Matthew Rhys.Network FX also managed to score five wins thanks to the success of We solved it, this room is so erse,' he sings, before jokingly pointing out they're all Democrats.Suddenly, Ricky Martin appears and stops the production.'You haven't solved it,' he says. 'This is way too white.'The production then continues as Martin leads them in a dance, before Burgess jokes: 'We know exactly where we stand, with Roseanne!'          'No!' the rest of the celebrities yell.Suddenly Andy Samberg descends from the ceiling, perched on a cutout of the moon. 'Uh hello?' Thompson says into the phone. 'Oh, we did not solve it, I see, long way to go, okay, cart before the horse, okay very good. I appreciate your call''But what about me?' he croons. 'Is there any room for a straight white guy like me?'As he stands on the stage McKinnon looks at him and goes, 'You can't be a part of this'.They then announce they're going to 'check all the boxes', bringing out a whole group of erse dancers wearing a rainbow of colors.RuPaul suddenly appears, saying he has a phone call for Thompson.'We solved it, we solved it, we solved it,' they happily sing as fake firework graphics explode behind them on a screen'Uh hello?' Thompson says into the phone. 'Oh, we did not solve it. I see, long way to go, okay, cart before the horse, okay very good. I appreciate your call.''Thank you, Ru,' he says, handing back the phone.'You called me up here for one line in your stupid skit? Y'all ain't right,' RuPaul replies, alluding to the lack of LGBTQ characters on television.    Legend: Betty White, 96, charmed the audience as she was honored at the 70th Primetime Emmy Awards at the Microsoft Theater in Los Angeles Monday Then John Legend appears on the stage to sing, as Chrissy Teigen jokingly tries to avoid being included in the camera shot as it turns to the audience.'They solved it,' Legend croons to the crowd. 'Through the magic of TV!''We solved it, we solved it, we solved it,' they happily sing as fake firework graphics explode behind them on a screen. The night was dominated by Amazon's The Marvelous Mrs Maisel, which took home five trophies, including Best Comedy and Best Lead Actress in a Comedy.But it was Glenn Weiss who stole the show after he proposed to his girlfriend following his win in the Directing for a Variety Special category Netflix was the biggest winner of the night, taking home seven Emmy Awards thanks to wins from series including The Crown, Godless, and Black Mirror.Claire Foy took home the best lead actress trophy for her portrayal of Queen Elizabeth II, disappointing many who hoped to see Oh make history. Game of Thrones only took home two awards, but made a splash with a win in Best Drama, reclaiming the trophy it won in both 2015 and 2016.    Victory speech: Thandie Newton used foul language on Monday during her acceptance speech at the Primetime Emmy Awards in Los AngelesPeter Dinklage took home the show's second award with a Supporting Actor in a Drama Emmy, helping HBO nab six wins in total.The Americans also finally got some recognition in its final season, scooping up awards for Writing in a Drama Series and Lead Actor in a Drama, which went to Matthew Rhys.Network FX also managed to score five wins thanks to the success of The Assassination of Gianni Versace, which took home three awards. The event got a mixed response, with viewers commenting their disapproval of the hosts. One celebrity who seemed to sum up the feelings about the SNL stars, who host Weekend Update together, was the ever-memable Chrissy Teigan who appeared to visibly cringe during a joke about Roseanne's show being cancelled over her racist tweet. title: SNLs Colin Jost Michael Che mixed reviews Emmy hosting
story: Michael Che and Colin Jost kicked off the Emmys with jokes that ranged from Roseanne Barr's canceled show to Ronan Farrow's impact on the #MeToo movementTaking red carpet PDA to a whole new level! Today co-anchors...'He literally tried to murder me': Tom Arnold is pictured...Share this articleOne celebrity who seemed to sum up the feelings about the SNL stars, who host Weekend Update together, was the ever-memable Chrissy Teigan who appeared to visibly cringe during a joke about Roseanne's show being cancelled over her racist tweet.Jost joked that Roseanne was 'cancelled by herself but picked up by white nationalists.''She's had a rough year,' Che added. 'I heard Roseanne is moving to Israel.'     One celebrity who seemed to sum up the feelings about the SNL stars, who host Weekend Update together, was the ever-memable Chrissy Teigan who appeared to visibly cringe during a joke about Roseanne's show being cancelled over her racist tweet          Teigen  pulled an awkward face and attempted to scoot down in her seat, out of shot          'I mean damn, how messed up is your life you have to go to the Middle East to get peace of mind?' The hosts then mentioned Laurie Metcalfe, who received a supporting actress nomination for her work on Roseanne, to a round of applause from the audience.'You know how great you have to be to get nominated for Roseanne now?' Che asked the crowd. 'That's like nominating a cop for a BET award, it doesn't happen - that would be weird.' The camera then panned to John Legend, who hosted the BET awards earlier this year, and his wife and model Teigen who pulled an awkward face and attempted to scoot down in her seat, out of shot.          Another remark that stirred up controversy at the 70th Annual Emmy Awards show, was when Che explained that his mother would not be watching.'My mother is not watching,' Che said. 'She says she doesn't like watching white award shows because you guys don't thank Jesus enough.''That's true,' he continued. 'The only white people that thank Jesus are Republicans and ex-crackheads.''Okay @DaytimeEmmys #MichaelChe I am not a Republican neither an ex- crack head do I get to thank #Jesus according to your standards? I'm a believer any and WILL thank JESUS! Really bad writing,' one viewer tweeted. 'Michael Che - do not knock JC - Jesus is just all right with me.''More Colin Just and Michael Che's opening monologue bombed harder than I ever could have dreamed,' another tweeted.          Another joke that ided opinion was Che's comparison of The Handsmaid's Tale which 'is like the white women's version of 'Roots'.'Roots with bonnets,' which some tweeting that it was the 'joke of the night' while another tweeted: 'Thought these guys were going to be bad but this is beyond bad.'But some of the heaviest criticism wasn't at the more controversial jokes, but the overall tone which many slammed as dull and awkward.  Dylan Hesse tweeted: 'At first I thought 'okay that opening number was decent, this may be good' and then that opening monologue by che &amp Jost was flat and the show has been an awkward, boring mess since #Emmys.'

title: The Reparation Emmys Michael Che hands Emmys black artists won
story: One of the biggest hits of the evening was Che's skit about the Reparation Emmys, which featured Marla Gibbs from The Jeffersons, Kadeem Hardison from A Different World, and John Witherspoon from The Wayans Brothers          Marla Gibbs' impact as the Black maid on The Jeffersons was finally noticed and recognizedBut there was also another joke as to how he got hold of the trophies to begin with. Che joked he obtained the golden accolades from disgraced actor and comedian Bill Cosby. 'Boring and awkward': SNL's Colin Jost and Michael Che get...Oscars director Glenn Weiss steals the show when he PROPOSES...Share this articleAlthough Cosby never won an Emmy for NBC sitcom The Cosby Show, he won three of the Emmys during the course of his career becoming the first African-American to win one in 1966.The skit began with Che joking how he wanted to 'right some wrongs' and handed an Emmy to Marla Gibbs who starred as maid Florence Johnston on The Jeffersons. He visited Jimmy Walker from the show Good Times before heading onto Kadeem Hardison, formerly Dwayne Wayne on A Different World.    Jimmy Walker from the show Good Times received one of the Repatriation Emmys          Kadeem Hardison, formerly Dwayne Wayne on A Different World, finally got what he deservedFinally, he saw that John Witherspoon, of The Wayans Bros., got his Emmy, as well.Che then handed out a 'Reparation' win to Jaleel White who played Steve Urkel on the show Family Matters.Che described White as a trail-blazer saying that without him there would have been no Obama.  He described his character as 'the OG black man' and added: 'Without you there'd be no Donald Glover, no Kanye West. There'd be no Obama.'He also commiserated with Jermaine Fowler about the lack of awards 'The Wire' had received as they sat in a cafe.Jermaine said: 'Did you know that nobody from 'The Wire' ever won an Emmy?'          John Witherspoon was acknowledged for being a funny father figure in The Wayans Bros          Jaleel White was the quintessential man who can do both when he switched from Steve Urkel to Stefan Urquelle in Family MattersReferencing Geoffrey Owens, the former 'Cosby Show' actor who was photographed working at a Trader Joe's, Michael said: 'I know, and Bryan Cranston won like six for Breaking Bad.'You know he only won because he's white, right? If he was black he'd probably be bagging groceries somewhere.'Bryan himself could be seen scowling in the background as the pair chatted.The show opened without the hosts, who came in after a musical number called 'We Solved It', which focused on the ersity problem in Hollywood and featured the likes of Kate McKinnon, Kenan Thompson, Aidy Bryant, Tituss Burgess, Kristen Bell, Sterling K. Brown, RuPaul, Andy Samberg, Ricky Martin and John Legend.          'Without White, there'd be no Donald Glover', Che said, 'No Obama!' To which, White asked: 'Did I do that?'          Bryan Cranston, pictured, won six Emmys for Breaking Bad and was the butt of a jokeThe 'Weekend Update' hosts then gave a political monologue addressing various high-profile issues.On the issue of ersity, Colin quipped: 'There's even more ersity coming to TV. There's a 'Latino Magnum, P.I.', there's gonna be a black Samantha in a reboot of 'Bewitched'.'But it's gonna get balanced out – it's gonna get balanced out by an all-white reboot of 'Atlanta' called '15 Miles Outside of Atlanta', and it focuses on white women who call the police on the cast of 'Atlanta'.'And commenting on the allegations of sexual misconduct in Hollywood - which were spearheaded by Ronan Farrow's investigative journalism, Colin said: 'Netflix, of course, has the most nominations tonight. That's right, and if you're a network executive, that's the scariest thing you could possibly hear except maybe, 'Sir, Ronan Farrow is on line one.' '          Tichina Arnold was given her Repatriation Emmy for being the best sitcom actress thanks to her roles in Martin and Everybody Hates ChrisThe hosts also highlighted the fact the evening's guests were allowed alcohol within the theater for the first time.Michael said: 'You know, it is an honour to be here sharing this night with the many talented and creative people who haven't been caught yet.'Colin quipped: 'This year, the audience is allowed to drink in their seats. Hope you're excited about that. Because the one thing Hollywood needs right now is people losing their inhibitions at a work function.'          Che joked that the Emmys he gave out were awards taken back from Bill Cosby who won three in 1966, 1967 and 1968Later in the show, the pair took a moment to acknowledge director Glenn Weiss's on-stage proposal to girlfriend Jan Svendsen.Michael quipped: 'My girl is actually here too. I want to ask her something. Shall we eat later, or...?'Colin added: 'There's so many guys who didn't win with engagement rings in their pockets right now!'But the 'Saturday Night Live' stars also took a moment to get serious for an important issue, appealing for help for those affected by Hurricane Florence last week.Colin said: 'If you're watching right now at home, please during this commercial break, consider going online and donating or texting giveflorence to 41411 to support the American Red Cross Direct Relief and Team Rubicon.'These charities have helped so much to rebuild in Houston and in Puerto Rico and they are ready to help in the Carolinas and Virginia now.'

title: HBO Netflix home 23 Emmys
story: Peter Dinklage accepts the Outstanding Supporting Actor in a Drama Series award for Game of Thrones onstage during the 70th Emmy Awards at Microsoft Theater on September 17, 2018 in Los Angeles, California          The tie between Netflix and HBO came after Game of Thrones won for best drama series category          Claire Foy accepts the Outstanding Lead Actress in a Drama Series award for The Crown onstage during the 70th Emmy Awards at Microsoft Theater on September 17, 2018 in Los Angeles, CaliforniaNetflix scooped 112 nominations and HBO was honored with 108, followed by FX Networks with 50 and Showtime coming in last with 20.Game of Thrones roared back onto the Emmys battlefield with 22 bids but faced a formidable opponent in The Handmaid's Tale - last year's top drama series.The dystopian sci-fi series drew 20 bids, including one for last year's best actress winner, Elisabeth Moss, and supporting bids for Alexis Bledel, Ann Dowd, Yvonne Strahovski and Joseph Fiennes.Donald Glover's Atlanta was the top comedy nominee with 16 bids, poised to take advantage of this year's absence of three-time winner Veep.

title: Manchester Uniteds Marouane Fellaini sends Love Island star 23 private messages Instagram
story: Tina Stinnes' boyfriend (pictured, left, with the Love Island Star) responded to Fellaini's advances on Instagram (right, Fellaini at Manchester Airport today)          Matthew (pictured with Tina) did not take kindly to the midfielder's advances on social media          He uploaded the footballer's messages - which read 'Hey' and 'How are you?' - with the instruction: 'Fellaini get out of my girlfriend's DMs.'Tina first found fame on Made in Chelsea dating Jamie Lain and Alex Mytton before a romance with Spencer Matthews but began dating Matthew, who is the son of Baroness Scotland, this year.          Tina first found fame on the reality TV show Made In Chelsea and began dating Matthew earlier this year. Her new boyfriend was less than impressed with Fellaini (pictured, right, today at Manchester Airport)  Fellaini (right) sent flirty private messages to Tina Stinnes (left) much to the annoyance of her boyfriend, who replied on Instagram          Fellaini was warned off Tina (pictured) by Duchess Scotland's son, who uploaded his attempts to flirt online She lasted 21 days in the villa when she appeared on the second series of ITV2's Love Island in 2016. Midfielder Fellaini was last known to be dating 38-year-old Victoria Bonya, the Russian Playboy model. Share this articleBut she appears to have moved on, sharing images of herself with a new man on social media.The footballer also dated porn star Roxanne Jeffers and Lara Binet, who was crowned Miss Belgium.            The reality TV personality (pictured) first found fame on Made in Chelsea, dating two of its stars and having a fling with another  His other exes include former Miss Belgium Lara Binet and porn star Roxanne Jeffers, the ex-girlfriend of love rat Ashley Cole, 37.Three years ago the World Cup semi-finalist sent nude images of himself to the lingerie model Eglantine-Flore Aguilar.Matthew's mother, Patricia Scotland, employed an illegal immigrant while she was Attorney General and was fined £5,000 in 2009.

title: Cambridge educated GP worked Mother Teresa faces struck off
story: GP Richard Dean, 58, faces a tribunal after texting a patient and asking her on a lunch date to discuss aid workA Cambridge-educated doctor who worked with Mother Teresa faces being struck off after he texted a patient suggesting a lunch date after raiding her medical records.GP Richard Dean, 58, messaged the woman after he treated her for a bad back and she was absolutely 'gobsmacked' when he asked her to a pub, a tribunal heard.Mr Dean suggested they meet up at his local  in the Cotswolds to discuss their shared interest in the global refugee crisis and her role as an aid worker.The father of two said he was planning future humanitarian projects - but had previously been warned about crossing doctor-patient boundaries. Today the GP - a keen artist and former Green Party council candidate - is facing a disciplinary panel accused of inappropriate conduct and data breaches. The hearing was told the patient had not given a statement about her encounter with Dean as long as she never has to see him again.But a Medical Practitioners Tribunal will still consider if he should be struck off. The unnamed woman, referred to as Patient A, was suffering from back pain and spoke to Dean  about the possibility of going to a local chiropractor.But three days after the consultation she received the iMessage from Dr Dean saying: 'I would love to know more about your work if you are free this weekend you could tell me about it over a pub lunch.' It emerged the GP had got her number by accessing her medical records.          The rural GP admits he went too far when he texted the woman three days after their appointment to discuss her bad back'No evidence' having high levels of bad cholesterol causes...Can you really rely on a GP you only see on an app? Two...Mother-of-two whose son battled eczema that left him looking...Surgeons warn Fitbit fad is putting extra pressure on the...EXCLUSIVE: Gerry McCann to open up about his mental health...Share this articleDean told the Manchester hearing: 'She had explained fairly quickly that she wanted to discuss her back pain. It's relevant to ask with back pain about their job if they do a lot of sitting or walking and my interest immediately peaked when I heard about her refugee work and that interest took over.'Previously I did volunteer work for Mother Teresa in 1981, worked in Jordan and refugee camps, looking after children.           The alleged victim has not given any statement apart from a wish never to see Dean again'I put her number as a contact in my phone but only used it once. I now would never do that again as I understand about privacy and information'.'She came in with back pain and that was the focus of the consultation but I allowed my own interests to get in the way of the appointment.'I honestly didn't think she would find it inappropriate and I am completely devastated as I do not want to upset patients'.He has attended a course on maintaining boundaries between doctors and patients and says he has learned his lesson.The Medical Practitioners Tribunal Service was told the incident occurred on April 11 2017 when Dean was working as a locum for a single day at a surgery in Gloucester. Iona Neve of NHS England said: 'We had a face to face meeting with Dr Dean but he did not seem to understand why the patient might be uncomfortable and lacked significant insight.'It was worrying - his body language was more relaxed than expected and his attitude was poor and the information wasn't going in. There was almost a lack of understanding of why patient A felt uncomfortable and felt the need to complain.'He was dismissive and his attitude was inadequate. He says it was profession to profession as they had a common interest in refugees. He liked to chat to his patients and often ran late to talk to them. 'He didn't seem to accept that some people may feel this is uncomfortable and didn't want that. Patient A didn't want to see Dr Dean again but she didn't want to make a further complaint.'  The Cambridge-educated doctor has been warned about crossing doctor-patient boundaries in the pastThe hearing was told Dean had been given a warning in 2016 after another female patient made a complaint about him. At the time he gave an apology and a letter of advice was provided to him about professional standards.According to his Facebook page Dean whose oldest daughter works as an engineer in Stockholm and whose younger daughter is starting a degree at Nottingham university, studied social and political sciences at Cambridge before qualifying in medicine at Goldsmiths, University of London. He also studied a BA in Fine Art.He admits the allegations and the hearing continues.

title: Student leapt bedroom window landed HEAD pavement
story: Alix Taylor, pictured here in hospital, started hallucinating, stripped naked, and plummeted from the first floor  The image, shared by her sister on Facebook, shows blood coming from her ears and her matted hairOne show lying in a hospital bed, battered and bruised, and another shows her sitting in a wheelchair, with her hair matted in blood, while a close up shot shows crusted blood in her ears - showing the dramatic impact her fall had.   Ms Taylor had been on a night out in Glasgow with friends when one of her male friends was violently sick and 'appeared to have been spiked.'In a lengthy Facebook post Ellie told how her sister left the nightclub 'visibly drunk' and crying.She said her sister made it home and was comforted by her flatmate before going to bed.  British tourist is IMPALED through leg by parasol after...Mother-of-three, 25, dies a week after falling from 11th...Share this articleShe wrote: 'Fast forward about an hour, and two passers-by had heard awoman's frantic screams for help.'They rushed round to see Alix completely naked balancing outside on her window sill. She was completely terrified of whatever was inside the window, and she clearly felt that the first floor window was her only escape.'The passers by assumed it was a sex attack she was trying to escape from, and rang emergency services while trying to climb up to help her. 'Unfortunately, whatever was inside was too much and Alix either jumped or fell from the window and landed head first on the concrete, fracturing her skull and causing major bleeding inside her head- blood was coming out her ears.'The passers-by say they will never forget the sound her head made when she hit.'          Ms Taylor's swollen and lacerated feet. It is feared her drink was spiked by GHB before she jumpedPolice were called to find no one inside her flat apart from her flatmates who had been sleeping. She added: 'Before she jumped, Alix had pulled things out from under her bed and her room was ransacked, with cushions all over the floor.'On a recent holiday, Alix and my mum had to do this before bed as scorpions kept appearing in the hotel room. Therefore, we have pieced together that Alix was hallucinating, possibly thinking her room was full of bugs.'Alix can't remember anything after leaving the club. Due to the fact another in the group was spiked- and how suddenly intoxicated she was, her strange behaviour (being upset), and what happened to her back at home - we completely believed her drink had been spiked. Her symptoms match those of a reaction to date rape, that could have been put into her drink.'We are sharing this story to urge you to be so so careful with your drinks in clubs, and not only that, if you suspect someone in your group may have been spiked, sleep in the same room as them and don't leave them.'Ms Taylor is now out of critical care and expected to make a full recovery.Her sister added: 'She has been extremely lucky, we could easily be planning her funeral just now.'

title: Marc Benioff net worth revealed buys Time Magazine
story: Marc Benioff speaks at the opening of the Salesforce Tower, tallest building in San FranciscoWho is Marc Benioff?Marc Benioff is the Chairman, co-CEO and co-founder of Salesforce and under his leadership, has ensured that the cloud computing company was the fastest-growing top-five enterprise software company and the top provider of Customer Relationship Management (CRM) software around the world.According to Salesforce, since being founded in 1999, the organisation is now a Fortune 500 company and employs over 30,000 people, also being recognised as the Most Innovative Company by Forbes, the number one Best Place to Work by Fortune and the 15th Most Admired Company in the World by Fortune.Marc was also named Innovator of the Decade by Forbes, ranked third on Fortune’s 2017 Businessperson of the Year list and has been recognised as one of the World’s 25 Greatest Leaders by Fortune and the 15 Best-Performing CEOs by the Harvard Business Review.His efforts in transforming equality in leadership have earned Marc honours by GLAAD, the Billie Jean King Leadership Initiative and Variety Magazine with its EmPOWerment Award. Alongside this, Marc also created the 1-1-1 philanthropy model, that uses Salesforce’s resources to improve communities.          Marc Benioff delivers the keynote speech during the DreamForce Conference in San FranciscoWith his wife Lynne Benioff, they have also focused on improving children’s health, the environment, public education and homelessness. The Benioffs have also given over $250 million to the University of California, San Francisco to build children’s hospitals in both San Francisco and Oakland.Marc and Lynne also created the Benioff Ocean Initiative at the University of California, Santa Barbara to progress the study and research in ocean issues. Marc also serves as an inaugural Chair of WEF’s Forum Center for the Fourth Industrial Revolution.Before founding Salesforce, he spent 13 years at Oracle Corporation, where he was the youngest Vice President in company history, and his penchant for technology and business was clear from the age of 14, when he sold his first piece of software How to Juggle for $75.Marc also founded his first company Liberty Software, which created video games, a year later. He also received a BS in Business Administration from the University of Southern California, where he was on the Board of Trustees. In 2014, he was awarded an honorary degree of Doctor of Humane Letters.           Marc Benioff and Lynne Benioff attend will.i.am's i.am.angel Foundation TRANS4M 2017 GalaTime MagazineIt was announced that Meredith Corp. had sold Time Magazine to Marc and Lynne Benioff on September 16 for $190 million in cash, the purchase of Time and other publications of Time Inc. having been completed earlier this year.The Benioffs are purchasing Time as a personal investment and the transaction is unrelated to Salesforce.com, where Benioff is chairman, co-CEO and co-founder and would not be involved in any journalistic decisions.Meredith President and CEO Tom Harty said in a statement: 'We're pleased to have found such passionate buyers in Marc and Lynne Benioff for the Time brand. For over 90 years, Time has been at the forefront of the most significant events and impactful stories that shape our global conversation.’The publisher of magazines such as People and Better Homes &amp Gardens put four Time Inc. publications up for sale in March, but negotiations for the sale of the three other publications - Fortune, Money and Sports Illustrated - are continuing.Before the sale was revealed, Benioff revealed in an interview that he and his wife were investing 'in a company with tremendous impact on the world, one that is also an incredibly strong business. That's what we're looking for when we invest as a family.'          Marc Benioff and his wife Lynne pose for photos with San Francisco Mayor Willie BrownMarc Benioff net worthMarc Benioff’s net worth has accumulated to approximately $6.6 billion, according to Forbes and the publication also lists the Salesforce pioneer as the 404th richest billionaire in the world, owning around 5 percent of the cloud computing firm he founded back in 1999.Alongside this, he ranked  150th in the 2017 Forbes 400 list and was the 56th Richest in Tech in the same year also. His net worth has grown from $3.4 billion in March 2015 to $4.9 billion, but Forbes calculated that today, he is worth $2 billion more than at the start of this year, perhaps because of the Time purchase.The Time acquisition will reportedly cost Benioff around 21 percent of the estimated $900 million that he earned between the months of March 2017 to March 2018, which is only 4 percent of his previous $4.9 billion net worth, according to Business Insider.Bloomberg reported that Marc is 242nd on their Billionaires Index and probably earns staggering amounts, especially being a co-founder of Salesforce, which reported revenue of $10.5 billion in the twelve months leading up to January 31, 2018.Who is Mrs Hinch?
